sub_title: Compound Market Access Leader Europe Middle East & Africa (EMEA) at Janssen EMEA
summary:
Goal-oriented health economics, access and Real World Evidence (RWE) people leader with broad experience in the pharmaceutical industry at Global, European, UK and Dutch level, with strong analytical and research skills, a positive mindset and social capabilities with ambitions for a senior strategic leadership role.

- From March 2021 onwards, working as Compound Market Access Lead Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) to ensure that the right patients have timely access to gene therapies in the retina disease area
- February 2018 - February 2021, worked as Senior Manager Health Economics, Market Access and Reimbursement at Janssen in UK leading a team of health economists working to enable access to new innovations in the field of neuroscience and infectious diseases (vaccines) 
- Took on additional role as cross-functional team-lead for vaccines since June 2020 onwards
- 2017: worked within the European, Middle East and African region (EMEA) Market Access Team for neuroscience (dual citizenship)
- 2017: president of the Young Innovators of Medicines (younger department of Dutch association of pharmaceutical companies)
- From 2014 - February 2018, worked as Manager Health Economics, Market Access and Reimbursement at Janssen Netherlands in infectious diseases, neurosciences, hematology and oncology 
- 2014: did stretch assignment (2 days a week) for Janssen Global Health Economics, Market Access and Reimbursement Team in infectious diseases (hepatitis C)
- Worked fulltime as Global Business Manager Marketed Products as well as Global Product Team Lead for Dukoral (cholera vaccines) from January 2012 until October 2014 for Crucell, affiliate of Johnson & Johnson at Crucell's HQ, Leiden, The Netherlands
- Worked fulltime as Junior Manager at Business Management department (mix of business development and strategic marketing) of Crucell's paediatric franchise, from November 2010 - January 2012 at Crucell's HQ, Leiden, The Netherlands
- Worked as a pharmacist, from August 2008 - October 2010 at Apotheek Koert, Utrecht, The Netherlands

- MSc Business Administration at Rotterdam School of Management. Graduated cum laude (with distinction) in September 2010
- MSc in Pharmaceutical Sciences at University of Utrecht
- NIMA-A course at NHA
- Work experience for almost 10 years in different pharmacies with various functions, 

Specialties: 
- (Inter-)national Market Access
- Health Economics
- Reimbursement and negotiations
- Real World Evidence
- Marketing (strategic and managing)
- Access policy shaping
- M&A experience

profile_positions.description: As the European Market Access and Value Advisory Group of ARM - the alliance of companies working in the field of regenerative medicines (Gene and Cell therapies) - our main objective is to optimize the European access environment for gene and cell therapies
profile_positions.title: Member of Alliance of Regenerative Medicine (ARM) European Market Access and Value Advisory Group

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for developing, delivering and executing an Europe, Middle East & Africa (EMEA) Market Access strategy for multiple new (gene) therapies within the field of retina, one of the Company's flagships. 
Providing strategic market access leadership at the brand level, expertly representing the Health Economics Market Access and Reimbursement (HEMAR) function within the EMEA cross-functional team, building strong relationships and effective collaboration within the matrix. In doing so, I will shape the IBVT agenda and decision-making to ensure that strategic plans fully meet the needs of market access in key countries. I will be responsible to co-shape the global market access strategies, including integrated evidence generation plans and payer tools that meet the needs of the EMEA region. I will lead the development of regional brand value propositions and collaborate through the functional network with EMEA operating company HEMAR managers to deliver timely, optimal reimbursement in a highly challenging environment across a diverse region with complex and differing needs.
profile_positions.title: Compound Market Access Leader Europe Middle East and Africa (EMEA)

company.name: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for organizing and/or optimizing patient access to new interventions in the field of Neurosciences and Infectious Diseases (vaccines) in the United Kingdom, including NICE and SMC submissions and integrated evidence generation.
Cross-functional UK team lead for Vaccines since Jun 2020.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager Health Economics, Market Access and Reimbursement and Team Lead Janssen UK

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Development assignment as HEMAR (Health Economics, Market Access and Reimbursement) manager in the Neurosciences EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) team from April 2017 onwards for ~50% of the time. Focus: preparing for launch of Intranasal Esketamine. 

Main focus areas in NL:
- Hematology, primarily Non Hodgkin Lymphoma (From Jan 2017 onwards)
- Oncology, primarily prostate cancer (from Sep 2015 - Jan 2017)
- Infectious Diseases and Vaccines, primarily HIV, Hepatitis C and RSV (from Oct 2014 - Jan 2017)
- Neurosciences, primarily schizophrenia and depressive disorders (from Oct 2014 - March 2017)
- Real World Evidence (from 2015 onwards)
- Companion Diagnostics (from 2017 onwards)
Ensured reimbursement for 5 innovative drugs in 7 different indications and led various projects to increase patient access

From August 2016 - March 2017: Development Assignment for Strategic Account Management within Hematology (Multiple Myeloma)

In addition to that, president of working group at Young Innovators of Medicines (Young Nefarma, association of all innovative pharmaceutical companies active in the Netherlands) in 2016
profile_positions.title: Manager Health Economics and Market Access

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Development assignment: Supporting the Global Commercial Strategic Organization Hepatitis Team in Market Access and Health Economics projects for simeprevir and future Hepatitis C compounds
- Set up Standing Global Payer Advisory Panel
- Created Global HepC RWE Research Framework
profile_positions.title: Global Manager Health Economics and Market Access

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Development assignment: Supporting the Health Economics, Market Access & Reimbursement team to prepare for the launch of ibrutinib in the Dutch market
- Led the selection and prioritization of projects that enhances the value proposition of ibrutinib
- Created Easy To Use Budget Impact Models for Key Account Managers
- Wrote notifications ibrutinib for reimbursement approval by ZiNL (HTA-body Netherlands)
profile_positions.title: Manager Health Economics and Market Access

profile_positions.description:
The Young Innovators of Medicines is a department of the Dutch branch organization of innovative pharmaceutical companies (Vereniging Innovatieve Geneesmiddelen). The department is ran by a maximum of one representative per company, which totals 25+ active members. The department is led by a board of six board members. Four of the board members are chairing the four working groups that work on the topics: Partnerships, Interaction, Talent & Development, and Debate & Recommendation.

My role is to chair the board, represent the Young Innovators of Medicines at external meetings and stay connected and aligned with the board of the Dutch brand organization of innovative pharmaceutical companies. In addition to that, I led the development of a document describing the Vision of the Young Innovators  about the future developments in the Dutch healthcare market and specifically the role of pharmaceutical companies in these developments. The document is used as a guidance for discussion with a.o. the Minister of MoH.
profile_positions.title: Chairman Of The Board

company.name: Crucell - affiliate of Johnson and Johnson

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for Dukoral, Crucell's cholera vaccine (on global Net Margin)
- Since Jan 2013, led Global Product Team Dukoral and responsible for lifecycle management projects
- Quinvaxem marketing and forecasting
- In 2012, Inflexal V supply negotiations and process improvements
- Business wide projects: building business cases for e.g.,: entering new countries, participating in regional business deals (e.g., in Middle East or Latin America), clinical trials, and developing a new presentation of existing vaccines. All resulting in the creation of advices for management team.
profile_positions.title: Business Manager Marketed Products

profile_positions.description:
- Create and update business case model to valuate organization for a potential acquisition
- Create and update population based forecasting model for pentavalent vaccines and specifically Quinvaxem global sales
- Create and manage global marketing plans for Quinvaxem
- Manage business case for pipeline product and be part of development project core team
profile_positions.title: Junior Business Manager Paediatric franchise

profile_positions.description: Pharmacist in public pharmacy Koert (80-110 employees) in Utrecht, 12 hours per week and 40 hours per week during holidays. Primary tasks: patient care, giving oral information, and also inserting and checking prescriptions and checking medicine-computing-signals and if necessary follow them up. Since summer 2009 also at least 4 hours per week organizing the medicine distribution of prisoners in prison region Utrecht, in Houten.
profile_positions.title: Pharmacist

profile_positions.description: Building a framework which can be used to measure their value for the parties involved in this Public-Praivate Partnership. Subsequently refining it by empirical and theorectical research.
profile_positions.title: Intern Strategy & Business Development

profile_positions.description: Internship at Molecular Oncology Group, in the Oncology Research unit in Westmead, Sydney, Australia; Identification of domains involved in interactions between MAL2 and its binding partners, 6 months, 40 hours per week. Acquired much knowledge concerning the tasks of a researcher and learned many techniques such as cloning DNA using mould.
profile_positions.title: Internship
